story:
The first micro-thin sleeve that
extends the life of your batteries by up to 8x.

Batteroo is the world's first micro-thin sleeve that slips over your batteries and instantly extends their life by up to 8x. The key is that most devices only tap a fraction of a battery's energy. Batteroo taps into the remaining energy that is usually thrown away. 


Batteroo comes in AA, AAA, C, and D variations, and has a micro-thin design to slip over your battery and fit neatly back into your device's battery compartment. The 9V Batteroo will be available next year. 

Here's what the experts are saying! 

 

UL, one of the oldest and most prestigious Labs, has also performed independent Performance testing of a Garmin Golf GPS, side by side, with and without Batteroo. In this test, we can see approximately 6x the battery life with Batteroo. Please visit our website ( https://www.batteroo.com/) to read the full report. 

 

As Seen On: 
 

 

The Technology Behind Batteroo

 

Our proprietary circuitry maintains optimal output voltage.

 

Batteroo is an intelligent voltage management and delivery mechanism device made of thin stainless steel that slips over your battery and fits neatly back into your device's battery compartment.
 
Significant number of batteries thrown away still has a lot of energy left in them. Using proprietary circuitry to maintain an optimal output voltage, Batteroo allows the end device to access the untapped energy in the battery and makes it last longer. 
 
We are happy to announce that Batteroo has successfully completed FCC's (Federal Communications Commission) Compliance testing under the applicable scope of EMC. Please visit our website ( https://www.batteroo.com/ ) to read the full report. 
 
Value and Performance 

Your Batteroo saves you money every time you use - and reuse


Batteroo can make a dramatic difference on new and most "used" batteries. Batteroo tends to have a more dramatic effect with high-drain devices, however we are confident you'll enjoy the huge battery life increases with Batteroo.
Batteroo save you money by reducing the number of batteries you have to purchase. As long as you take care of your Batteroo, it's re-usable. We realize that the amount of money you save with Batteroo depends on how much the batteries cost, and how effective Batteroo can be with your device. Take a look below!
 

*http://www.bestbuy.com/site/energizer-max-batteries-aa-4-pack/150115.p?id=1051384046217

 

Refer 1 friend and get a FREE Batteroo 4 pack

We have just updated our referral program for all who have contributed to our campaign so far. Now you’ll get maximum rewards for sharing the Batteroo Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family! For every 1 friend who buy Batteroo, you will get one free 4 pack of AA Batteroo!

There’s no limit: more referrals means you can win more free Batteroo.

Here’s how to participate:

1.  Login to your indiegogo account

2.  Click the “Link” icon on the Batteroo indiegogo page

3.  Paste that link in your e-mails to friends, and on any social media.

That’s it! The link you create is unique and will allow us to ID all your referrals.

 

Environmental Impact

Batteroo saves our environment by reducing number of "Perceived" dead batteries that are thrown away
 

Every year, over 15 billion batteries end up in landfills. If we lined up all the batteries back to back that we use in just one year, it would be 466,000 miles long.
 

 

 

 

 

 

By the time billions of batteries reach a landfill, they have already created a significant carbon footprint. Greenhouse gas emissions from sourcing raw materials and factory production, plus transportation of batteries around the globe results in potentially hazardous implications for our planet. On top of it all, less than 2% of batteries are recycled. 

The solution is simple. Consume less batteries. Use Batteroo.

 
Product Development

Here's a look at where we started and what's to come. 

 

Original sketches of the Batteroo concept. 

The idea actually came to Frankie Roohparvar (Batteroo Chairman), when he was snowed in for the holidays but needed fresh batteries for his children's toys.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Batteroo Prototypes

The challenge was to create a sleeve that was thin enough to fit in a battery compartment, but also strong enough to be reused. 

 

 

 

The Latest Color

The latest sample has a rose-colored non-conductive coating to protect from shorting.

Protective Case Included

 

Batteroo comes with a rugged case to safely store your Batteroo when not in use.

Meet the Family!

Batteroo comes in AAA, AA, C, and D sizes. 

 

The Perfect, Eco-Friendly Holiday Gift

Share the love this holiday season! Batteroo is the perfect eco-friendly gift for your friends and family so they can enjoy their toys and gadgets longer. Batteroo is set to start shipping in November. 

 

Timeline

 

 

The Batteroo Team

 

 

 

Enhance Your FlashLight's Performance

 

Extend Your Golf Playing Time

 

 

Frequently Asked Questions:

How do I use it? The Batteroo is incredibly simple and user friendly. You simply slip the battery into the sleeve, and leave the sleeve on the battery for the remainder of the time the battery is being used. Once the battery is completely dead, keep the Batteroo and discard the battery. Repeat.

 

Can I reuse my Batteroo? Yes. If handled properly, the battery sleeve is reusable. Please don't intentionally bend or warp the sleeve.

 

Wait a second…how does it work? Good question! Batteroo is designed to boost the remaining voltage of a battery to an optimal level, therefore allowing the device to extract the remaining energy out of the battery.

 

Can I use Batteroo with rechargeable batteries? No, We do not recommend using the current version of Batteroo with rechargeable batteries. We are releasing a Batteroo for rechargeable batteries soon. We will keep you updated!

    

Does the battery need to be "dead" before you use the Batteroo? No, you can start using the Batteroo at any time, even a brand new battery, and you will get the benefits of extended battery life.

 

Is the Batteroo available for different types of batteries? Yes, Batteroo will be available for AA, AAA, C, and D batteries. The 9V Batteroo will be available next year.

 

Will the Batteroo fit in my device? Batteroo are designed to be as compatible as possible across multiple devices. We did everything possible to account for design variations of battery compartments and inconsistencies in the batteries themselves. One especially difficult device to account for was the Apple Keyboard, which the Batteroo successfully fits. Take a look here and see for yourself!

 

 

Though we have tried our very best, there may be instances where the battery compartment is just too tight to accommodate the Batteroo.

 

You have mentioned the sleeve is made of stainless steel...is there a possibility of the Batteroo shorting? No, the sleeve is covered with a non-conductive coating, which prevents shorting.

 

Is there any concern if a person incorrectly places the battery upside down in the Batteroo sleeve? No, Batteroo has a reverse polarity protection mechanism to prevent any issues.  If the Batteroo is placed incorrectly over the battery, neither the Batteroo nor the device will operate. Simply re-insert Batteroo in the correct position, and watch it start working again.

 

Are there limitations on devices that can use the Batteroo based on the current consumptions? No, the Batteroo sleeve is designed to deliver as much current as a battery is able to supply to the device.
 

How much longer will my batteries last with Batteroo? This will vary depending on the device. Batteroo will generally give you the best performance gains with devices that drain your battery life quickly. 

 

What do you mean that we tap into 80% of a battery's unused energy? Where is the up to 8x coming from?
With millions of different devices designed by different companies with different specifications for different applications, one number does not fit all. Mileage will vary, and some devices will get more battery life extension from Batteroo than others.Instead of arguing the best design cases vs. the worst, it would make sense to look at ACTUAL data from the field.

Although there have not been a lot of studies on the amount of energy left in batteries as they are thrown away, a very well done study was presented in the International Conference for Battery Recycling by Dr. Rolf Zinniker. He collected "dead" batteries from 19 different recycling locations/centers and the resulting experiments and measurements showed the following results:
 

 

% of "Dead" Batteries

Left Over Capacity (mAh)

Left Over Capacity %

10%

2165

103% *

20%

1962

93%

30%

1783

84%

40%

1559

74%

50%

1358

64%

60%

1165

55%

70%

998

47%

*Percentage relative to average charge in multiple types of batteries
 

This study shows that 10% of the batteries thrown away have roughly enough energy left in them to be considered Unused. 20% of the perceived "dead" batteries have, on average, 93% of their energy still left in them. This study further shows that if you take an average of 30% of the "least Dead" batteries, 84% of energy is still left inside. . If the device could have continued to operate at the same rate of power consumption until all the energy was drawn from the battery, the devices could have lasted roughly from 2 times to 14 times longer, based on this study. As can be seen from the actual real life data on batteries that are thrown away, Batteroo could significantly increase the battery's operating life by tapping into the energy that is thrown away. The full text of the study can be found at:

http://www2.ife.ee.ethz.ch/~rolfz/batak/ICBR2003_Zinniker.pdf

 

OfficialDuracellUK uploaded a video on youtube that shows how they were able to light up a Duracell Bunny LED light Sculpture using 192 perceived dead batteries. The video states that based on a sample from a UK recycling center, one third of batteries thrown away have up to 67% of usable power left inside. Below is the link to the video uploaded by OfficialDuracellUK. 

Can a bench power supply be used to show the voltage at which a battery stops working on a device? 

Using a power supply to determine the operating voltage of a battery operated device, and then using that voltage to determine the range of voltage for battery is completely wrong. It ignores the internal resistance of the battery. A video as well as a discussion on Batteroo's website addresses the fallacy of this approach. The link is found at:

For more in-depth analysis regarding this question, please visit our Batteroo website:
 https://www.batteroo.com/contact/#faq

Batteroo is the world's first micro-thin sleeve that slips over your batteries and instantly extends their life by up to 8x. The key is that most devices only tap a fraction of a battery's energy. Batteroo taps into the remaining energy that is usually thrown away. 
Batteroo comes in AA, AAA, C, and D variations, and has a micro-thin design to slip over your battery and fit neatly back into your device's battery compartment. The 9V Batteroo will be available next year.

story:
Imagine a world where everyone on the planet is energy independent.


Where simple next-generation solar systems generate five times the power per square foot of today's outdated systems.


Where you can place your solar system anywhere and take it with you when you move.


Where we've eliminated the pollution caused by our reliance on electricity generated using fossil fuel.


Don't just imagine this world. Help turn it into a reality.

     Your investment in Enviro-Design Laboratories can help us revolutionize the energy market by developing and bringing to market the world's smallest, most powerful, most efficient, most cost-effective, quickest and most easy-to-deploy solar power system - the Enviro-Sys solar energy producing system, powered by our proprietary Sunflower technology!


The Sunflower Revolution

     At Enviro-Design Laboratories, we believe our idea of capturing wasted light energy is the single most important thing that has happened to the production of electricity from the sun in sixty years. The idea that eliminates the weakness of current flat-panel solar systems, the idea that is the first step in allowing every person on the planet to become energy independent. 

Thinking Inside the Box

     At the core of our systems are EDL's Sunflower solar panels, which combine our PV cell technology with a unique reflective material and design to maximize energy efficiency. But it wasn't enough to improve the panels; we needed to improve the way they were deployed.  Current flat-panel solar installations consist of an array of solar panels, all facing the sun to capture the maximum amount of energy.  The trouble is, each panel only captures a fraction the total available energy; the rest is reflected back into the atmosphere. Think how much more efficient solar installations would be if they could capture and use all that reflected energy.  

     This insight led to the creation of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system.  Basically, the Enviro-Sys Sunflower consists of a box containing Sunflower solar panels.  Each PV cell in each panel absorbs the same amount as ordinary PV cells. But the unabsorbed light, instead of being reflected back into the atmosphere, is reflected to and captured by cells on the other panels in the box.  

     In addition to maximizing the absorption of the sun's energy, the Enviro-Sys Sunflower design provides a number of other benefits when compared to traditional solar systems.


Size

     Thanks to the patent-pending design of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower, its footprint is at a minimum 80 percent less than that of conventional solar systems generating the same amount of power, and it weighs far less. 

Enviro-Sys Sunflower design prototype:

     ·  Dimensions: 80cm x 120cm for total system

     ·  Footprint:  1m2 for total system

     ·  Installed PV cells: 1.5kw

Conventional PV panel solar energy system:

     ·  Dimensions: ~ 1m x 1.75m per panel (dependent on manufacturer)

     ·  Footprint:  ~ 8 to 10m2 for total system (dependent on watt per panel) 

     ·  Installed PV cells: 1.5kw

     ·  Number of solar panels: 5

     The following video illustrates an Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system for a large household.  The system consists of two five-panel ES1.5 units attached to two ES1.0; together, they create a 5kw system with a total footprint of 3.25 m2.  In contrast a 5kw system installed with conventional PV panels has a total footprint of 32.5 m2. 

  

Stability

     Because the Enviro-Sys Sunflower is a cube, it is exceptionally strong and stable. Flat-panel solar systems, with their large surface area and flimsy support systems, are far less stable and may be blown off the roof by strong winds if not properly installed.


Ease of Installation

    Users can easily install the Enviro-Sys Sunflower in a matter of minutes, simply by placing it on the ground in any sunny location in a back or side yard, and  plugging it into their home's existing wiring system. The unit does not have to be positioned toward the sun.  User can even apply custom paint or decals to the Enviro-Sys Sunflower to suit their personal preferences.

     In contrast, installing unsightly traditional solar array systems can take days, as they are typically mounted on the roof. Moreover, the homeowner must install additional wiring to connect the system to the house.  

     Both systems will require a licensed electrician to meet net metering requirements.


Transportability

     For the first time, consumers have their own personal form of electrical generation that they can transport with them where and whenever they desire. When Enviro-Sys Sunflower owners move, they can simply unplug the Enviro-Sys Sunflower system and plug it in again at their new home, where it will start generating electricity instantly. 

     Once a traditional solar array is installed, users cannot economically move it to a new location. This is a very significant drawback for today’s highly mobile society, and one that the solar industry, as a whole, has refused to address.


Ease of Repair and Upgrade

     A major feature of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower is its unique plug-in panel with 'go/no go' indicators that alert the user if one of the solar panels is not working. When a faulty 'no go' panel is noted, the user simply opens the lid, removes the faulty panel, and inserts a replacement panel. This feature eliminates the need to replace entire solar array systems when one panel fails. Retrofitting an existing Enviro-Sys Sunflower with new, upgraded panel is also a breeze; the user simply pulls out the old panels and inserts the new ones.  And because when one panel goes down the others continue working, users experience no power outages. 


Cost Effectiveness

     The cost of an installed solar system has significantly decreased over the last 60 years - but most of that decrease is due to lower unit costs.  Soft costs - that is, non-hardware costs - are still high, accounting for more than 50 percent of total installed cost.  In 2013, cost of installation was estimated to be 50 cents per watt, or $750 for a 1.5kw system.

     EDL's Enviro-Sys Sunflower plug-and-play unit significantly lowers the soft costs. Users simply place the unit in a convenient location and plug it into the house electrical panel. Licensed electricians are required only to install the unit’s input plug in the residence’s electrical meter and to validate that the installation meets building codes and government regulations. 


 What Started the Revolution

        

     I'm Ronald Bracken, founder and chairman of Enviro-Design Laboratories (EDL) and inventor of the revolutionary, patent-pending. trapped-light Sunflower technology the heart of our Enviro-Sys Sunflower 1.5kw solar generator (ES1.5).   

     I didn't set out to create a revolution in solar energy. But when a friend told me the U.S. was paying the outrageous price of $400 a gallon for gas and diesel fuel in Afghanistan, and that terrorists were targeting those who transported fuel,  I thought "What a waste of human life and taxpayer dollars. There has to be a better way, cheaper way to provide energy to the troops."  

     Solar energy seemed like a potential solution, but as I started to research the topic, I realized the solar industry was in desperate need of improvement. A once promising technology - photovoltaic (PV) - had become old and tired, was stuck in a rut, and hadn't fundamentally changed in 60 years. Was there anything I could do to advance the industry?

 

     I started my process by questioning almost every knowledgeable person I met, learning about PV solar technology and asking them what they considered the strengths and the weaknesses of existing solar systems.  


Here's what I Learned:

STRENGTHS

WEAKNESSES

Users benefit from lower-cost electricity.

Solar panels must be installed by a contractor, and installation is expensive.

Solar energy reduces users' carbon footprint.

Arrays of panels installed on roofs are flat-out ugly.

Users are independent of today's energy grid.

The area covered by arrays is much too large.

Systems are not easy to repair.

Systems cannot be upgraded.

Panels cannot be moved from one location to another.

Homeowners cannot take their solar systems with them when they move.

     With the information I had gained in hand, I started trying to make better, more efficient PV cells. I quickly realized, however, that almost everyone in the solar industry is trying to do the same thing.  Yet despite being backed by millions of dollars, developers have made little headway in either improving PV cells' energy efficiency or eliminating the weaknesses of the solar energy systems based on them.

     So I took another look at what I was doing - and at how PV cells work.  All solar units actually absorb very little of the sun's energy - typically about 14 to 18 percent; What this means is most of the potential energy is bounced back into the sky. "What a waste," I thought.  And I realized that the key to improving the efficiency of solar energy systems lay not in trying to improve the efficiency of cells - something that hadn't happened in 60 years of effort - but in improving how solar panel installations are configured. Why not try to capture that wasted light energy and bounce it back onto the cell's surface to generate even more energy? The idea for the Sunflower light chamber was born. 


Disaster Relief

     The ES1.5 is perfect for disaster relief applications. Combined with a battery pack, the system can easily be transported anywhere - even air-dropped into disaster zones - and instantly provide energy around the clock. People can simply plug in and charge their cell phones, laptops, or other devices.  

     Flat solar-panel systems are difficult to use for disaster relief as they are large, not easily transported, require support structures to position the panels towards the sun, and are not easy to set up. Nor can people easily draw energy directly from such systems.


Giving Back

     Once production is up and running, EDL plans to match all Indiegogo donations, dollar-for-dollar over our campaign goal, with donations of Enviro-Sys Sunflower units to the American Red Cross and other disaster relief agencies. We feel that this is the responsible way to give back to the community, as you never know when you may need their help in the future. 

We wish to extend a very special thank you to the San Diego/Imperial Counties Region chapters for all the help and support they have given us. 


Accomplishments and Near-term Milestones


18vdc Battery Charger - Early Proof of Concept

completed 2012/13

     In this photograph you will see the last of three proof of concept prototypes that were built. Each of the three moved the technology forward by solving the objectives in a logical manor. This, the last of this series contained all of the features found in the proposed production system. 


The "Big Bloom" Enviro-Sys Sunflower Proof-of-Concept Model

completed 2013/14

   

     The "Big Bloom" proof-of-concept model is a multifunctional unit that tracks the output of each PV cell. This model not only proved the mathematical limits of the output of the Sunflower light chamber but also provided insight and statistical data proving that the output of the Sunflower is not affected by how it is positioned with regard to its angle to the sun or to the direction in which it faces. 


Enviro-Sys Sunflower 640 Watt Solar System

completed 2014/present

     A one-off beta unit designed for harsh environments and mobile applications, the ES-LC 16-10 is a 640-watt system that employs our EP-16 solar panels, which will be the backbone of a variety of scalable Enviro-Sys Sunflower units for residential, mobile, and off-grid use.  


Below is the hourly (8am to 5pm) Volt output measurement of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower 640 Watt Solar System. These measurements were recently conducted in El Cajon, CA. The unit is hand made and 3rd party testing and validation will be conducted in the near future.


ES1.5 attached to ES1.0 unit with a combined output of 2.5KW

                                                         in progress/present

                     

   


This concept illustration represents ES1.5 and the ES 1.0 piggy-backed to form a 2.5 kw system. These are classified as first article production units and will be manufactured utilizing finalized production tooling, assembly components, and processes. Upon completion the first of these units will be distributed to various test sites, including, secondary validation and safety certification agencies.

The Revolutionaries

     Ronald Bracken, Chairman and Co-founder.  Ron is the inventor of the Sunflower technology and Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar system.  Most recently he was a contractor and the owner-operator of an insurance company. Previously, he was business unit manager and consulting engineer for Palomar Systems, Inc., a supplier of ultra-high-speed termination equipment to the monolithic semiconductor industry. Ron holds a BS in mechanical engineering from the University of Florida.

     Johannes Johansson, CEO, President, and Co-founder. Johannes' real-world entrepreneurial expertise comes from his background in R&D-focused small businesses. In addition to his role at EDL, he is operations manager of Artery Therapeutics, Inc., a biotech company focusing on peptide treatment for cardiovascular disease.  Johannes holds a degree in economics from UC San Diego and maintains a project management professional (PMP) certificate.

     Ron and Johannes have been good friends for more than 10 years and have worked together on EDL's Sunflower from the outset.  As a team, they have a synergistic combination of talents, skills, and entrepreneurial experience that will ensure the ability of EDL to bring innovative products to market.


Help Us Revolutionize Solar Energy

     We need your help to make the Sunflower-based Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system a reality. Enviro-Design Labs' goal is to raise $800,000 or more, which will enable us to move beyond the prototype stage and ultimately to bring our technology to market. Your donation will pay for achieving these goals.

·  Finalize design for manufacture

·  Conduct third-party safety testing (UL) and performance validation

·  Receive net metering equipment certification from the big electrical companies

·  Set up a U.S.-based manufacturing facility and prepare for manufacturing first 10       units

·  Create 6-10 new jobs in the U.S.


Donation Benefits

     Donors will receive an email once residential and commercial Enviro-Sys Sunflower units are available for distribution. EDL will allocate a large portion of the first production runs to donors with early bird pricing.


Product Data Sheet


“Count the Sunflowers” contest

Please watch the EDL-show and submit your answers in the comments section for the chance to win grand prizes!

Ronald Bracken's second visit on Green Machine Radio Show, aired June 29, 2014 on KCBQ AM 1170 in San Diego.

Supportive Partners

Please visit www.EDLSolar.com for more information!


Thank You

story_txt:
Imagine
a world where everyone on the planet is energy independent.


Where simple
next-generation solar systems generate five times the
power per square foot of today's outdated systems.





Where
you can place your solar system anywhere and take it with you when you move.





Where
we've eliminated the pollution caused by our reliance on electricity generated
using fossil fuel.





Don't
just imagine this world. Help turn it into a reality.

     Your
investment in Enviro-Design Laboratories can help us revolutionize the energy
market by developing and bringing to market the world's smallest, most
powerful, most efficient, most cost-effective, quickest and most easy-to-deploy
solar power system - the Enviro-Sys solar energy producing system, powered by our proprietary Sunflower technology!


The Sunflower Revolution 
     At
Enviro-Design Laboratories, we believe our idea of capturing wasted light
energy is the single most important thing that has happened to the production
of electricity from the sun in sixty years. The idea that eliminates the
weakness of current flat-panel solar systems, the idea that is the first step
in allowing every person on the planet to become energy independent. 
Thinking Inside the Box
     At the
core of our systems are EDL's Sunflower solar panels, which combine our PV
cell technology with a unique reflective material and design to maximize energy efficiency.
But it wasn't enough to improve the panels; we needed to improve the way they
were deployed.  Current flat-panel solar
installations consist of an array of solar panels, all facing the sun to capture
the maximum amount of energy.  The
trouble is, each panel only captures a fraction the total available energy; the
rest is reflected back into the atmosphere. Think how much more efficient solar
installations would be if they could capture and use all that reflected energy.
 
     This insight
led to the creation of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system.  Basically, the Enviro-Sys Sunflower consists of a box containing Sunflower solar panels.  Each PV
cell in each panel absorbs the same amount as ordinary PV cells. But the
unabsorbed light, instead of being reflected back into the atmosphere, is
reflected to and captured by cells on the other panels in the box.  
      In addition to maximizing the absorption of the sun's energy, the
Enviro-Sys Sunflower design provides a number of other benefits when compared to
traditional solar systems.


Size 
     Thanks to
the patent-pending design of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower, its footprint is at a minimum 80
percent less than that of conventional solar systems generating the same amount
of power, and it weighs far less.  
Enviro-Sys Sunflower design prototype:
     ·  Dimensions: 80cm x 120cm for total
system
     ·  Footprint:  1m2 for total system
     ·  Installed PV cells: 1.5kw 
Conventional PV panel solar energy system:
     · 
Dimensions: ~ 1m x 1.75m per panel (dependent on manufacturer)
     · 
Footprint:  ~ 8 to 10m2 for total system (dependent on watt per panel) 
     · 
Installed PV cells: 1.5kw 
     · 
Number of solar panels: 5
     The
following video illustrates an Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system for a large
household.  The system consists of two
five-panel ES1.5 units attached to two ES1.0; together, they create a 5kw system
with a total footprint of 3.25 m2. 
In contrast a 5kw system installed with conventional PV panels has a total
footprint of 32.5 m2. 

  



Stability




     Because the Enviro-Sys Sunflower is a cube, it is exceptionally strong
and stable. Flat-panel solar systems, with their large surface area and flimsy
support systems, are far less stable and may be blown off the roof by strong
winds if not properly installed.




Ease of Installation
     Users can
easily install the Enviro-Sys Sunflower in a matter of minutes, simply by placing it on
the ground in any sunny location in a back or side yard, and  plugging it into their home's existing wiring
system. The unit does not have to be positioned toward the sun.  User can even apply custom paint or decals to
the Enviro-Sys Sunflower to suit their personal preferences.
     In
contrast, installing unsightly traditional solar array systems can take
days, as they are typically mounted on the roof. Moreover, the homeowner
must install additional
wiring to connect the system to the house.  
     Both
systems will require a licensed electrician to meet net metering requirements.

Transportability

     For the
first time, consumers have their own personal form of electrical generation
that they can transport with them where and whenever they desire. When Enviro-Sys Sunflower owners move, they can simply unplug the Enviro-Sys Sunflower system and plug it in again
at their new home, where it will start generating electricity instantly.  
     Once a traditional solar array is installed, users cannot economically
move it to a new location. This is a very significant drawback for today’s
highly mobile society, and one that the solar industry, as a whole, has refused
to address. 

Ease of Repair
and Upgrade


     A major
feature of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower is its unique plug-in panel with 'go/no go'
indicators that alert the user if one of the solar panels is not working. When
a faulty 'no go' panel is noted, the user simply opens the lid, removes the
faulty panel, and inserts a replacement panel. This feature eliminates the need
to replace entire solar array systems when one panel fails. Retrofitting an
existing Enviro-Sys Sunflower with new, upgraded panel is also a breeze; the user simply
pulls out the old panels and inserts the new ones.  And because when one panel goes down the
others continue working, users experience no power outages.  

Cost Effectiveness

     The cost
of an installed solar system has significantly decreased over the last 60 years
- but most of that decrease is due to lower unit costs.  Soft costs - that is, non-hardware costs -
are still high, accounting for more than 50 percent of total installed cost.  In 2013, cost of installation was estimated
to be 50 cents per watt, or $750 for a 1.5kw system.
     EDL's Enviro-Sys Sunflower plug-and-play unit 
significantly lowers the soft costs. Users simply place the
unit in a convenient location and plug it into the house electrical panel. Licensed electricians are required only to install the unit’s input plug in the residence’s electrical meter and to validate that the installation meets building codes and government regulations. 



 What Started the Revolution
             I'm Ronald Bracken, founder and chairman of Enviro-Design
Laboratories (EDL) and inventor of the revolutionary, patent-pending.
trapped-light Sunflower technology the heart of our Enviro-Sys Sunflower 1.5kw solar
generator (ES1.5).   

     I didn't set out to create a revolution in solar energy. But
when a friend told me the U.S. was paying the outrageous price of $400 a gallon
for gas and diesel fuel in Afghanistan, and that terrorists were targeting those
who transported fuel,  I thought "What
a waste of human life and taxpayer dollars. There has to be a better way,
cheaper way to provide energy to the troops."  

     Solar energy seemed like a potential solution, but as I
started to research the topic, I realized the solar industry was in desperate
need of improvement. A once promising technology - photovoltaic (PV) - had
become old and tired, was stuck in a rut, and hadn't fundamentally changed in
60 years. Was there anything I could do to advance the industry?
 
     I started my process by questioning almost every
knowledgeable person I met, learning about PV solar technology and asking them
what they considered the strengths and the weaknesses of existing solar systems.  




Here's what I Learned:




STRENGTHS


 WEAKNESSES



Users
benefit from lower-cost electricity.


Solar panels
must be installed by a contractor, and installation is expensive.




Solar
energy reduces users' carbon footprint.


Arrays of
panels installed on roofs are flat-out ugly.




Users
are independent of today's energy grid.


The
area covered by arrays is much too large.





Systems
are not easy to repair.





Systems
cannot be upgraded.





Panels
cannot be moved from one location to another.






Homeowners
cannot take their solar systems with them when they move.


     With the information I had gained in hand, I started trying
to make better, more efficient PV cells. I quickly realized, however, that
almost everyone in the solar industry is trying to do the same thing.  Yet despite being backed by millions of
dollars, developers have made little headway in either improving PV cells'
energy efficiency or eliminating the weaknesses of the solar energy systems
based on them. 

     So I took another look at what I was doing - and at how PV
cells work.  All solar units
actually absorb very little of the sun's energy - typically about 14 to 18 percent; What this means is most of the potential energy is
bounced back into the sky. "What a waste," I thought.  And I realized that the key to improving the
efficiency of solar energy systems lay not in trying to improve the efficiency
of cells - something that hadn't happened in 60 years of effort - but in
improving how solar panel installations are configured. Why not try to capture that wasted
light energy and bounce it back onto the cell's surface to generate even more
energy? The idea for the Sunflower light chamber was born. 

Disaster Relief


     The ES1.5
is perfect for disaster relief applications. Combined with a battery pack, the
system can easily be transported anywhere - even air-dropped into disaster
zones - and instantly provide energy around the clock. People can simply plug
in and charge their cell phones, laptops, or other devices.  
     Flat solar-panel
systems are difficult to use for disaster relief as they are large, not easily
transported, require support structures to position the panels towards the sun,
and are not easy to set up. Nor can people easily draw energy directly from
such systems.







Giving Back
     Once
production is up and running, EDL plans to match all Indiegogo donations,
dollar-for-dollar over our campaign goal, with donations of Enviro-Sys Sunflower units to
the American Red Cross and other disaster relief agencies. We feel that this is
the responsible way to give back to the community, as you never know when you
may need their help in the future. 
We wish to extend a very special thank you to the San Diego/Imperial Counties Region chapters for all the help and support they have given us. 


Accomplishments and Near-term Milestones




18vdc Battery Charger - Early Proof of Conceptcompleted 2012/13



     In 
this photograph you will see the last of three proof of concept 
prototypes that were built. Each of the three moved the technology 
forward by solving the objectives in a logical manor. This, the last of 
this series contained all of the features found in the proposed 
production system.  

The "Big Bloom" Enviro-Sys Sunflower Proof-of-Concept Model
completed 2013/14

        The
"Big Bloom" proof-of-concept model is a multifunctional unit that tracks
the output of each PV cell. This model not only proved the mathematical limits
of the output of the Sunflower light chamber but also provided insight and
statistical data proving that the output of the Sunflower is not affected by
how it is positioned with regard to its angle to the sun or to the direction in
which it faces.  
Enviro-Sys Sunflower 640 Watt Solar System
completed 2014/present



     A one-off beta unit designed for harsh environments and
mobile applications, the ES-LC 16-10 is a 640-watt system that employs our
EP-16 solar panels, which will be the backbone of a variety of scalable
Enviro-Sys Sunflower units for residential, mobile, and off-grid use.  

Below is the hourly (8am to 5pm) Volt output measurement of the Enviro-Sys Sunflower 640 Watt Solar System. These measurements were recently conducted in El Cajon, CA. The unit is hand made and 3rd party testing and validation will be conducted in the near future.


ES1.5 attached to ES1.0 unit with a combined output of 2.5KW
                                                         in progress/present

                     
   

This concept illustration represents ES1.5 and the ES 1.0 piggy-backed to form a 2.5 kw system. These are classified as first article production units and will be manufactured utilizing finalized production tooling, assembly components, and processes. Upon completion the first of these units will be distributed to various test sites, including, secondary validation and safety certification agencies. 

The Revolutionaries

     Ronald
Bracken, Chairman and Co-founder.  Ron is
the inventor of the Sunflower technology and Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar system.  Most recently he was a contractor and the
owner-operator of an insurance company. Previously, he was business unit
manager and consulting engineer for Palomar Systems, Inc., a supplier of
ultra-high-speed termination equipment to the monolithic semiconductor
industry. Ron holds a BS in mechanical engineering from the University of
Florida.

     Johannes
Johansson, CEO, President, and Co-founder. Johannes' real-world entrepreneurial expertise comes
from his background in R&D-focused small businesses. In addition to his
role at EDL, he is operations manager of Artery Therapeutics, Inc., a biotech
company focusing on peptide treatment for cardiovascular disease.  Johannes holds a degree in economics from UC
San Diego and maintains a project management professional (PMP) certificate. 
     Ron and Johannes have been good friends for more than 10
years and have worked together on EDL's Sunflower from the outset.  As a team, they have a synergistic
combination of talents, skills, and entrepreneurial experience that will ensure
the ability of EDL to bring innovative products to market.


Help Us Revolutionize Solar Energy
     We need
your help to make the Sunflower-based Enviro-Sys Sunflower solar energy system a reality.
Enviro-Design Labs' goal is to raise $800,000 or more, which will enable us to
move beyond the prototype stage and ultimately to bring our technology to
market. Your donation will
pay for achieving these goals.
·  Finalize design for manufacture
·  Conduct third-party safety testing
(UL) and performance validation
·  Receive net metering equipment
certification from the big electrical companies
·  Set up a U.S.-based manufacturing
facility and prepare for manufacturing first 10       units
·  Create 6-10 new jobs in the U.S.




Donation Benefits

     Donors will receive an email once residential and commercial Enviro-Sys Sunflower
units are available for distribution. EDL will allocate a large portion of the
first production runs to donors with early bird pricing.

Product Data Sheet







“Count the Sunflowers” contest


 Please watch the EDL-show and submit your answers in the comments section for the chance to win grand prizes!

story:
Charge Anywhere Under the Sun

 

For Solar Paper, we’re manufacturing the latest and most efficient solar panel. Because of this, Solar Paper is the world’s smallest solar charger for the amount of potential wattage it can generate.

As part of this campaign, we’re offering 5 watt, 7.5 watt and 10 watt, 15W chargers, with 2, 3, 4 or 6 panels, respectively. In bright sunlight, the 5 watt charger can fully charge an iPhone 6 in about 2.5 hours, which is similar to a wall charger. For more powerful devices like tablets or cameras, or for faster charging, you’ll want to opt for one of the higher-wattage versions. (There’s a handy guide further down this page to help you pick the right one. Max power is 15W.6panels in total)

Compatible Devices

Solar paper can charge almost any device that recharges via USB, including, smartphones, tablets, walkie talkies, flashlights, portable game consoles, cameras, video cameras, and rechargeable batteries. 

Thin, Lightweight and Durable

Solar Paper measures just 9 x 19 x 1.1 cm when folded, and each panel weighs only 65~75 (2 oz). Watt-for-watt, it is 70 percent smaller and lighter than our closest competitor. Most importantly, Solar Paper is just 1.1 cm deep, at its thickest point, compared to 3.8 cm for our competitor, easy to carry it!

We wanted to make Solar Paper as compact as possible and also allow you to expand it in the future if you need to charge larger devices. Our design solution was to create a set of folding solar panels held together using strong magnets with silicon connectors. Only need two panels and want to save some weight? No problem. Just bought a tablet and need more wattage to charge it? Also not a problem. This feature creates unique benefit in economical and environmental aspects. Users don’t have to purchase all different outputs of solar chargers. Thus, it saves resources and money. Furthermore, it solved conventional problem of wire-disconnection caused by repeated folding/unfolding and extend its life span. Clever green design!


Set it and Forget It

Unlike other simple devices with a battery, smart devices like smart-phones and tablets would not accept low current caused by insufficient sunlight. In this case, devices have to be manually reset. That means that users have to unplug and replug the cable every time a cloud passes overhead or you walk through a shadow. This is very inconvenient.

We wanted to make Solar Paper as easy as possible for anyone to use, so we have integrated ‘auto-comparison technology’ into the charger, to make it automatically resume powering your devices, after the sun starts soaking it again.

Geek Out with Real Time Readings

Backers from our first solar project, Solarade, suggested that we find a way to show how much solar energy the panel is generating in real time. We thought this was a great idea, because, in addition to being very cool, it would let you see how the panel performs under different weather conditions.

For Solar Paper, we’ve included an LCD Amp meter that shows exactly how much current is flowing from the charger to your device at any time. We wouldn’t include this  LCD if we were not absolutely confident about our technology and our product. No false advertising. No false promises.

Picking the Right Wattage  


We’re offering Solar Paper in four versions: 

  • 5 Watt      (1 main panel with controller + 1 sub panel)

  • 7.5 Watt  (1 main panel with controller + 2 sub panel)

  • 10 Watt   (1 main panel with controller + 3 sub panel)

  • 15 Watt   (1 main panel with controller + 5 sub panel)

* Each panel is 2.5W

Question 1: How do I know which is suitable for my device?

You can find out how much power your device needs to charge by checking your existing wall charger.

The charger that comes with popular smartphones like the iPhone 5, 6 and Galaxy S, are 5 volts, 1 amp.    

( 5V * 1A = 5 Watts )

Some larger phones like the iPhone 6+ and Galaxy Note come with a higher powered wall chargers.  10Watt will charge devices quickly and stable.

( 5V * 2A = 10 Watts )

Charging Tablet like iPad, Galaxy Tab. In this case, you can go with the 10 W+ version of Solar Paper.

If you’re charging a device that isn’t “smart”, like a flashlight or Bluetooth speaker, you can use any version of Solar Paper. Lower watts means slower charging.

Question 2: How’s the weather?

Solar Paper, like all solar panels works best in direct sunlight. If you live somewhere cloudy, (indoor artificial light will generate power, but it isn’t enough to charge devices like smartphones at all), you’ll want a higher wattage version to charge stably and quickly.

Many “smart” devices like smartphones and tablets won’t accept low power(250mA for 5W smartphones, 750mA for 10W tablets). This could happen if you’re charging on cloudy days or close to sunset, and your device will display an error message like: “This accessory is not supported.” If you’ll regularly charge in less than full sunlight, consider to choose higher power than your device's wall charger. For an example, I use iPhone 6. Its wall charger is 5W. But Seoul is quite foggy in these days due to pollution. Thus, 7.5 watt or 10 watt Solar Paper is more suitable.

Question 3: Am I in a hurry? 

Higher watts generally means faster charging, and this is especially true when you don’t have direct sunlight. The 10 watt Solar Paper has twice the potential power output of the 5 watt version. (But it doesn't mean that it can charge faster than a wall charger.)


Mission of YOLK  

After the following success of the Solarade, I established a solar company and named it YOLK. It reflects our desire to supply solar energy to electronic devices as yolk does to the fetuses. Our mission is to bring this wonderful green technology to more people. I wish YOLK can be a bridge between solar energy and people, including not only campers and hikers or early adopters but many others who face battery problems in their everyday lives. I believe that solar technology can relieve the battery problem we face and contribute to making the world greener.


YOLK is a solar company specialized in high quality solar modules and panels. While we produce our own products like Solarade(2014) and Solar Paper(2015). We also supplied customized solar modules on client’s demands. Solar modules are mainly used for iot & ict devices.


After graduating from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago with BFA emphasis in design object, I have created nolla design studio to continue doing what I love and do best: making things. After the first solar charger project, Solarade, I was attracted by the synergy of technology and design. So I founded a solar charger company, YOLK. YOLK is a small company for now, but this team has the world's top solar techonology and a vision to spread this wonderful green technology to everyone's daily life. You will find the most innovative and advanced solar products at YOLK.

Sam Lim has been working in power industry for over 18 years and solar industry for 7 years. He has numerous patents and a wide arrange of experiences with developing power products.


Risks and challenges

We are preparing upgraded Solar Paper. Upgraded Solar Paper will have stronger Magnets and finish. There will be very little risk that it will be delayed since all other components are ready.

We've been always sincere to our backers. We successfully deliver the projects that we promised. We would like to share the comments from our backers.  

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/159052311/solarade-smart-and-powerful-solar-charger?ref=nav_search


Solar Paper's package design and connectors

This could happen if you’re charging on cloudy days or close to sunset, and your device will display an error message like: “This accessory is not supported.” If you’ll regularly charge in less than full sunlight, consider to choose higher power than your device's wall charger. For an example, I use iPhone 6. Its wall charger is 5W. But Seoul is quite foggy in these days due to pollution. Thus, 7.5 watt or 10 watt Solar Paper is more suitable.Question 3: Am I in a hurry? Higher watts generally means faster charging, and this is especially true when you don’t have direct sunlight. The 10 watt Solar Paper has twice the potential power output of the 5 watt version. (But it doesn't mean that it can charge faster than a wall charger.)

Mission of YOLK  

After the following success of the Solarade, I established a solar company and named it YOLK. It reflects our desire to supply solar energy to electronic devices as yolk does to the fetuses. Our mission is to bring this wonderful green technology to more people. I wish YOLK can be a bridge between solar energy and people, including not only campers and hikers or early adopters but many others who face battery problems in their everyday lives. I believe that solar technology can relieve the battery problem we face and contribute to making the world greener.


YOLK's solar modules. We have technology to customize solar cells.
YOLK is a solar company specialized in high quality solar modules and panels. While we produce our own products like Solarade(2014) and Solar Paper(2015). We also supplied customized solar modules on client’s demands. Solar modules are mainly used for iot & ict devices.


YOLK team 
After graduating from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago with BFA emphasis in design object, I have created nolla design studio to continue doing what I love and do best: making things. After the first solar charger project, Solarade, I was attracted by the synergy of technology and design. So I founded a solar charger company, YOLK. YOLK is a small company for now, but this team has the world's top solar techonology and a vision to spread this wonderful green technology to everyone's daily life. You will find the most innovative and advanced solar products at YOLK.
Sam Lim has been working in power industry for over 18 years and solar industry for 7 years. He has numerous patents and a wide arrange of experiences with developing power products.


Risks and challenges
We are preparing upgraded Solar Paper. Upgraded Solar Paper will have stronger Magnets and finish. There will be very little risk that it will be delayed since all other components are ready.
We've been always sincere to our backers. We successfully deliver the projects that we promised. We would like to share the comments from our backers.  
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/159052311/solarade-smart-and-powerful-solar-charger?ref=nav_search

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1398120161/solar-paper-the-worlds-thinnest-and-lightest-solar/descriptionTest videosGreen greetings (in different languages) from sky.picked as must-see new product at Outdoor retailer show. Solar Paper in Singapore near sunset.                You can also find lots of fun review with images from other backers.



Solar Paper's package design and connectors

story:
Food Wrap is a Patent-Pending reinvention of everyday plastic cling wrap.

Food Wrap has been created first and foremost to solve one of the biggest problems remaining in the kitchen: how to wrap food without using single use plastics but also be stress-free to clean and manage. Food Wrap easily wraps your food items exactly like cling wrap! But, when you're done, you can place it in the dishwasher (or hand wash) and reuse over and over again for years to come! 

How great is that!?




 

 

 

 

Not only is Food Wrap the first practical reusable solution to cling warp, but it also solves many cooking issues. Food Wrap can completely replace Baking Paper and Tin Foil as well!

Food Wrap is heat resistant to 235 degrees Celsius or 445 degrees Fahrenheit. That means you can use Food Wrap in the oven, on the stove and even in the microwave. You can bake with it, cook with it, steam with and use it for almost any other use you can find for normal Baking Paper and Tin Foil.  

Food Wrap does all of this without producing any harmful chemicals or residues. The Food Wrap material is 100% FDA approved! It is a BPA Free, high quality silicone made especially with your health in mind. 




 

 

So what else can it do? On top of being able to wrap your lunch, fruit and other snacks, Food Wrap can also be used as an all-purpose lid. When stretched over a plate, bowl or container correctly, Food Wrap creates and airtight seal, meaning your food stays fresher in the fridge than when you used cling wrap!  




 

 

Food Wrap is pretty amazing stuff! It's easy to store as well, just fold it into quarters and stack in a draw or cupboard! 


 

 

And to top it all off, Food Wrap is super strong and durable. You can pull it to 3 times its size! When used correctly, it will never tear, break or rip! 


 

 

Why is Food Wrap so amazing? 

  • Made from 100% BPA free, FDA approved high grade silicone!
  • Unique Patent-Pending design 
  • 100% plastic FREE packaging! 
  • Infinitely washable and reusable 
  • Replaces the need for Cling Wrap, Baking Paper, Tin Foil and buying new container lids!
  • Keeps your food fresh!
  • Creates an airtight seal on your plates, bowls and containers to keep your food sealed and fresh for longer! 
  • Can be placed in the oven, microwave and stove top in temperatures up to 235 degrees Celsius or 445 degrees Fahrenheit.
  • Freezer friendly!
  • Stain Resistant 
  • Comes in the perfect 'wrapping' and 'covering' dimensions, 40cm x 30cm x 1mm (16 inches x 12 inches x 0.04 inches) 
  • Super strong and durable! Can be stretched to 3x its size! 
  • Saves the environment! 








 

 

 

 

Food Wrap is super easy to use! If you're using Food Wrap to wrap a sandwich, fruit or any other food item, you simply use it just as you would normal cling wrap! Super easy! It’s the same as you're used to, but you can wash it and reuse it over and over again! 


 

 

 

How to use Food Wrap on a Plate, Bowl or Container 

 

First, place your Food Wrap evenly over the container, being sure to cover all sides

 

Second, make sure to 'grip' the back side of the container and stretch the Food Wrap over the container, making sure all edges are evenly covered 

 

 

Then, just make sure all sides are even and that there are no air holes along the side of the container

 

Finally, just release the air by gently pushing down in the middle of the wrap over the container. This will release air and ensure an airtight seal has been achieved. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Food Wrap has unlimited potential uses in the kitchen. From wrapping food items, to being used as a lid or airtight container cover, to being used in your everyday cooking! The uses are endless! 

 

 

Wrap a Burrito or Wrap

 

Cover a Plate and Food

 

Wrap a Melon

 

Wrap a Sandwich

 

Use Food Wrap to Cook in the Microwave 

 

Store leftovers in the Fridge

 

Use to cook in the oven in replacement of Baking Paper or Tin Foil

 

Wrap and Cover anything! Any size, any shape! 

 

The potential uses for Food Wrap are endless :) 

 

 

 

Food Wrap comes in 2 pack types. 

4 Pack - Green, Red, Blue and Yellow 

3 Pack - All Clear 

 

The Packaging

This here is our first draft of the packaging. There are a few changes to be made, but this represents the packaging and style we want for Food Wrap. The packaging will be 41cm x 4cm (16 inches x 1.5 Inches). 

The packaging will be in a long rectangle box, similar to standard cling wrap. We are going 100% plastic free in our packaging to ensure that the positive impact of our customers using Food Wrap is maximised! 

The Food Wrap idea came from a simple lack of any real 'all round' cling wrap alternative. So we wanted to create something simple, safe, healthy and fun to use! 

The Food Wrap design, while simple, is the best size and thickness for a reusable clingwrap alternative. Make it too thin and it is impossible to clean and reuse, much like standard cling wrap. Make it too thick and it won't be easily pliable. Each Food Wrap is 40cm x 30cm x 1mm (16 Inches x 12 Inches x 0.04 Inches). These dimensions are what we found to be the best for a reusable cling wrap solution. 30cm x 40 cm (12 Inches x 16 Inches) is about how much cling wrap you would use to wrap most 

household lunch and everyday food items. The 1mm thickness on the other hand offers strength and durability. 

Our Food Wrap design is currently Patent Pending. 

 

THANK YOU :)

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of Transition Year students from Wilsons Hospital School located in Westmeath, Ireland. We are passionate about our environment and want to promote eco-friendly initiatives through better understanding of green energy technologies.

As part of our Transition Year program, we are undertaking a Product Design and Development module aimed at providing training to young people in basic engineering principles. The module requires that we adopt a project-led approach to tackling an engineering design challenge over a defined period.  

We have decided to start with an electric vehicle project, as we believe that with greater knowledge of how electric propulsion systems work, as the engineers and consumers of tomorrow we can make more informed choices about which technologies we employ in transitioning towards a more sustainable and eco-friendly future.

We have procured a donor project 2-seater Utility-Terrain-Vehicle (UTV), formerly powered by a 260cc petrol engine. It is our intention to carry out a ground up restoration of the UTV and specify and fit a suitable electric motor to convert it to an electric UTV (eUTV).

The primary costs related to the project are expected to be associated with purchase of the electric motor, batteries, and battery charger along with materials required as part of the restoration process. We hope to fund these project costs through donations from interested individuals and local businesses by way of either a crowdfunding and/or sponsorship model.  

Your support as project donors will be critical to our success, allowing us to harvest the full scope of learning opportunity available and to perhaps inspire our team to become the young engineers and entrepreneurs of tomorrow.​

 

What We Need

Funding requirements are broken down as follows:

Electric motor €1000

Batteries @1200

Battery charger €100

Materials (Replacement parts, paint, custom fabrication) €300

TOTAL FUNDING REQUIREMENT = €2600

 

The Impact

We are taking on this project as a learning opportunity to enhance our knowledge of the following:

  • Green Energy Technologies (with particular focus on Electrical Propulsion Systems).
  • Basic Automotive Engineering. 
  • Introduction to company structures and the roles allocated to different departments (e.g. Engineering, Operations, Sales and Marketing, Finance) as well as the cross functional role of Project Management. 
  • Engineering design constraints requiring tradeoffs between project scope, budget and timeline.
  • Company financing including choosing the appropriate funding model for a new start-up. 
  • Learning safe and responsible use of Social Media for the purposes of product promotion through sales and marketing initiatives.

 

We are also keen to better understand how technology can make a difference in shaping a more eco-friendly world and to use this knowledge to help influence a more sustainable way of life. 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is an ambitious project and as such it carries a number of risks and challenges. We have anticipated the main challenges as follows:

  • Sourcing replacement parts for restoration 

We have been fortunate to procure an off the shelf donor vehicle for which parts are readily available. Our intention is to rebuild and restore parts where possible both as a learning exercise and to reduce costs where it is practical to do so. 

  • Specifying and sourcing a suitable electric motor/batteries/charger

The electrical propulsion system will be based on off the shelf parts sourced from a reputable European based supplier. We plan on fitting a 5kW BLDC motor using a 48V system coupled with a 16 x LiFeYPO4 (3.2V/60Ah) Lithium Ion battery pack. Based on our calculations this should give us approximately a 15 mile range at nominal speed and with adequate acceleration for the purposes of this application. Use of a tried and trusted configuration and strict adherence to manufacturers specification and recommended layout should also reduce the risk of  unforeseen issues.

  • Funding does not reach the required target

We have specified a reasonably sophisticated battery pack and motor, but could scale this back for the initial proof of concept to reduce costs in line with available funding if required. The purpose here however is to learn about the latest trends in EV technology that might have a bearing on future products, so we will make best effort to ensure that our funding targets are realised.    

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We greatly appreciate any contribution, big or small! However, we would also ask those who may not be in a position to contribute at this time to make a concerted effort to help share news of our campaign, either through Social Media channels or even simply by word of mouth. Every little bit helps!

story:
SMARTER & FASTER

The World's Most Advanced Power Station & Solar Generator EVER

Energy is essential in all areas of our lives, our modern world wouldn’t exist without a stable power supply. This is why we designed Monster, THE WORLD’S FIRST APP-CONTROLLED SMART POWER STATION WITH WIRELESS CHARGING,  gives you uninterrupted power all day every day.

Review Video by TK Bay

"Whenever you need power, whenever the normal power is not available, Monster is the best portable power station that you can get! "

 

Review Video by EBPMAN Tech Reviews

"This is small and has soooo much potentials! "

 

Travel Into Wildness

Wherever you need power!

 

DC to AC Converter

2x 120V/230V AC Output

 

Monster vs. Other Products

Get Rid of Your Cables

Wireless Charger

The most compatible Qi wireless charging standard allows you to charge both iPhone and any Qi devices.

100,500mAh Huge Capacity

372Wh, Keep 55" LCD Working for 3 HRs

 

High Capacity, Light Weight

The Astronautic High Density 20650 batteries, provides larger capacity with smaller size.

100,500mAh, 30 x 20650 cells, 372Wh

 

Power 9 Devices

At The Same Time

With the 9 output ports and Wireless Charging Pad, Monster can charge or power at least 9 devices at the same time.

 

2x 120V/230V 300W AC Output

With the 120V 300W Pure Sine Wave AC Outputs, Monster can power small home appliances including your flat screen TV.

 

Ultra-Fast 60W PD USB-C Port

The USB-C port supports the fastest 60W PD input & output, you can charge the 13" MacBook Pro to 90% in 1 hour and you can fully charge your Monster in 6 hours.

 

iOS & Android Charging at up to

3x Faster Speed

120W Car Port DC

The cigarette lighter socket provides convenient DC output in the car when you're travelling.

 

Ultra-efficient Source of

Light and Power

Solar Charging Input up to 100W. Monster is great for camping, hiking, emergencies, or wherever your adventures may take you.

 

LED Lights

Up To 372 Hours

With the 2x 1W LED lights, Monster can provide illumination for all your adventures.

 

Pass-Through Charging

Charge and recharge at the same time

Independent charging and discharging circuit modules allow you to power or charge your devices while simultaneously recharging the Monster.

 

Smart Power Management System

The smart power management system allows you monitor the Monster battery level and you can turn the outputs on and off as required, as well as monitor the power of output on the APP or on the panel.

 

Bluetooth Connection for Android & iOS APP 

 

 

Safe Reliable and Endurable

Over a dozen international certificates and saefty features ensured the reliability and endurance

 

Designing and Prototyping

 

MULTI-PURPOSE

Camping power, RV Trip, Emergency, Medical Power, BEST MATE EVER!

 

Tech Specs

 

Stretch Goals

 

Timeline

 

About Allpowers

ALLPOWERS was founded in 2008, we are a team of designers and engineers with a mission to bring the best portable solar power products to everyone.  We've designed and produced a series of portable power storage devices in the past 10 years.  Our engineering expertise and supply chain efficiency ensured that we can create best in-class products that everyone can enjoy.

While we have been manufacturing best-selling electronic products for years, we also helped designed and manufactured a number of products for other brands. To ensure the safety and reliability, ALLPOWERS passed over a dozen international certificates including CNAS, TUV, FCC, CE, ROSH, SGS, ErP, PSE and UL.

We have spent months developing, testing and prototyping, even completed the molding before the campaign started. We only need your support to start the mass production.

ALLPOWERS in CES 2018 and HKTDC Hong Kong Electronics Fair 2018

story:
New Wardenclyffe Tribute to Tesla

100 Years ago , a genius inventor named Nikola Tesla, wanted to give EVERYONE FREE ENEGRY, FOREVER! Tesla's dreams were crushed by greedy monopolistic giants of the oil industry. Since then, we and our Mother Earth has suffered pollution and destruction of our environment.

Nikola Tesla held over 700 patents and over 1400 inventions world wide including AC electricity, inductive brushless motors, neon and fluorecent lights, radio tranmission, remote control, Tesla coils and many, many other fascinating electrical devices!

I'm planning to rebuild Tesla's Wardenclyffe tower to provide free WIRELESS energy to everyone!

I, along with my dad, have been studying "free energy" concepts and devices for several years now. We have studied much of Tesla's work and patents and have even recreated some of his experiments and work. My dad has degrees in electronics and computers. I'm a creative and resourceful thinker, researcher and developer with a passion to help people. With free wireless energy transmission, it would greatly improve the quality of life for billions of people all around the world! Literally, billions of people don't have access to clean water, lighting, refrigeration or cooking because of lack of power. TOGETHER, we change change this! We can bring in a New Golden Age of peace, happiness and abundance for ALL of humanity!

In the early 1900's, Tesla was building the Wardenclyffe tower in Shoreham, Long Island New York. Greedy millionaire, J.P. Morgan was funding the project which he believed was going to be a radio transmission tower. Tesla discovered that he could wirelessly transmit electrical power with the tower. Excited, Tesla went to J.P. Morgan and told him the "great news" that everyone...everywhere could have FREE electricity, Morgan became furious sputtering, "How can you put a meter on it?!" Tesla's tower was soon destroyed and Tesla was ridiculed into obscurity destined to die a lonely old man in a hotel room in New York.       

 

We need to recreate the Wardenclyffe tower! Tesla's real secret is that the Wardenclyffe was a prototype model for a larger tower! But his biggest secret was that these towers would produce Aetheric/Ether energy and therefore increasing the vibrational frequency of the whole planet allowing us higher states of conciousness physically, emotionally and spiritually!

I have not only studied Tesla's work extensively, but also closely follow the work of other brilliant Electrical Engineers such as Eric Dollard, Peter Lindemann and Thomas Joseph Brown. I am also currently in contact with a gentleman in Croatia, homeland of Nikola Tesla who happens to work at the Tesla museum in Belgrade. He has exclusive access to all of Tesla's personal notes and books and has studied them closely, coming up with a FULL description and plans for how the Wardenclyffe works! I understand how it all works as well, but it would be a great honor to work with him as well.

What we need and what you get!

Initially, we need funding, first and foremost in oder to aquire test equipment and research & development supplies. Also, we would like to secure a piece of property as soon as possible to start building a labaratory for the New Wardenclyffe tower. The lab will be funded by the people who contrubute, so it will be for "We the People", which means ALL of humanity! This could be the biggest turning point  in human history, become a part of history in the making! All funding contributors will have exclusive access by permission, to experiment and build in the lab and their name written on a plaque honoring them for their generous contribution. All contributors will be welcome to visit and explore free of charge. All contributors and volunteers will be commended in social networks for their generous contributions!  

The total estimated cost is $4,900,000 to complete the New Wardenclyffe tower. The tower itself is 187 feet and the grounding structure is 420 feet deep! The lab itself needs to be some distance away from the tower because otherwise sparks like to "play" in the lab, as Tesla put it. I plan to have a Tesla Science Discovery Center as well for people to learn about Tesla and try some of Tesla's inventions!

This project, New Wardenclyffe could change the world as we know it and make the power grid, nuclear and oil based fuels obsolete and improve the quality of life for everyone! Let's make Tesla's dream OUR reality!

Of course people will ask questions...$50,000 is just Phase 1 of my campaign...$50,000 will help to buy the property to build the Tesla Tech lab. I estimate the lab will cost $150,000-$250,000 all together.

I estimate that it will cost about $4.5 million to build the tower itself. The location is somewhat important as Ley lines are better, but remember, Tesla did his most profound experiments in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Tesla chose this spot to research natural electrical phenomenon...lightening. Tesla literally electrified the ground for 25-31 miles all around!!! And NOBODY has reproduced that kind of experiment...NOBODY!!! Eric Dollard is a super genius and one of my favorite people in EE! Eric has a heart of gold and I love that guy!  I follow his work closely and I am friends with his team! (Eric is kind of a loner, so I try not to contact him directly. I don't want to intrude.) I have watched and read A LOT of Borderlands Science's work. I'm very familiar with Peter Lindemann and learned from Peter's book, "The Secrets of Cold Electricity"! With the help of his book, my dad and I WIRELESSLY transmitted Cold Electricity about 10 feet across our living room! That was about 5 years ago and I really wish I had a video to prove it! So, you'll have to just take my word for it, I guess... I'm also friends with Thomas Joseph Brown as well. He and I chat about physics and natural archetypes of energies.                                 

Eric Dollard is a great man and I have the utmost love and respect for him! I'm not by any means trying to "step on his toes" at all, but Eric Dollard IS very inspiring to me and maybe the reason that I would have any chance of success. Tesla is and always will be my main inspiration of course, but if anyone can build a new Wardenclyffe, it is Eric Dollard! BUT....IF he does NOT succeed, then shall we wait another 100 years??? I say, "HELL NO!!!" We need people all over the world trying to do the same!!! I will share ALL the secrets I discover for ALL OF HUMANITY!!! Let's free the world with FREE ELECTRICITY FOR EVERYBODY!!!

If you can't contribute funds, then that's okay! There are other ways that you can help too! "Share" with your friends and family! Indiegogo also has "share" tools!

I will keep everybody posted on the progress! You can follow New Wardenclyffe Tribute to Tesla on Facebook. There's tons of valuable info on my page!

..."See the excitement coming!" Nikola Tesla

https://www.facebook.com/NewWardenclyffeTribute...
story_txt:
New Wardenclyffe Tribute to Tesla

100 Years ago , a genius inventor named Nikola Tesla, wanted to give EVERYONE FREE ENEGRY, FOREVER! Tesla's dreams were crushed by greedy monopolistic giants of the oil industry. Since then, we and our Mother Earth has suffered pollution and destruction of our environment. 
Nikola Tesla held over 700 patents and over 1400 inventions world wide including AC electricity, inductive brushless motors, neon and fluorecent lights, radio tranmission, remote control, Tesla coils and many, many other fascinating electrical devices! 
I'm planning to rebuild Tesla's Wardenclyffe tower to provide free WIRELESS energy to everyone!
I, along with my dad, have been studying "free energy" concepts and devices for several years now. We have studied much of Tesla's work and patents and have even recreated some of his experiments and work. My dad has degrees in electronics and computers. I'm a creative and resourceful thinker, researcher and developer with a passion to help people. With free wireless energy transmission, it would greatly improve the quality of life for billions of people all around the world! Literally, billions of people don't have access to clean water, lighting, refrigeration or cooking because of lack of power. TOGETHER, we change change this! We can bring in a New Golden Age of peace, happiness and abundance for ALL of humanity!
In the early 1900's, Tesla was building the Wardenclyffe tower in Shoreham, Long Island New York. Greedy millionaire, J.P. Morgan was funding the project which he believed was going to be a radio transmission tower. Tesla discovered that he could wirelessly transmit electrical power with the tower. Excited, Tesla went to J.P. Morgan and told him the "great news" that everyone...everywhere could have FREE electricity, Morgan became furious sputtering, "How can you put a meter on it?!" Tesla's tower was soon destroyed and Tesla was ridiculed into obscurity destined to die a lonely old man in a hotel room in New York.       
 
We need to recreate the Wardenclyffe tower! Tesla's real secret is that the Wardenclyffe was a prototype model for a larger tower! But his biggest secret was that these towers would produce Aetheric/Ether energy and therefore increasing the vibrational frequency of the whole planet allowing us higher states of conciousness physically, emotionally and spiritually!
I have not only studied Tesla's work extensively, but also closely follow the work of other brilliant Electrical Engineers such as Eric Dollard, Peter Lindemann and Thomas Joseph Brown. story:
I am Ali Fatahalla, a Nano-Technology 4th year undergraduate student in Zewail City for Science and Technology. I have various experience and knowledge in Integrated Circuit Design, Communication Systems, modeling CADs, Programming Tools and Physical Implementation. I have 2 years’ experience in the Communication and Aerospace Technologies Lab where I was engaged with simple robotics and electronics projects. Also, I got a solid base regarding fundamental sciences of Nanotechnology Engineering including but not limited to Nano Fabrication Techniques, Advanced Analog and Digital Electronics and Clean Room Facility Experience.

During the last summer, I've worked on novel technology for energy harvesting called TENG. Our research team have introduced a new optimized design to enhance the efficiency of energy harvesting. Our paper was accepted in NEWCAS IEEE conference in Canada (24-27th, June, 2018).

To further learn from my journey to present our work in NEWCAS conference, I've contacted Prof. Sawan in the university of Montreal to join his research team for this summer. I'll be working on designing analog interface block for sensors.

The travel and living expenses cost 2900 CAD (2238.70 USD) and due to currency inflation, I can only afford 900 CAD (694.77 USD) and I was hoping that you, enlightened people who believe in science, would help me to pursue my journey and passion to obtain knowledge.

The costs consists of:

- Flight tickets: 1085.04 CAD (836.87 USD)

- Monthly living cost:  600 CAD (465.2 USD), the internship period is 3 months.

- Visa cost: 217.04 CAD (167.48 USD)

 

As a way to payback to the society, I intend to organize a series of workshops and lectures to teach various engineering CAD Kits with the help of a local student organization.

I whole heartily believe in the generosity of each and every one of you!

Kindly, find the acceptance letter attached,
